page.title: 15ETTINGTON MEETING HOUSE
page.content: The Society of Friends,or Quakers,have worshipped in Ettington throughout their entire history and have suffered persecution and harassment at various times in the past.Their meeting house is one of the oldest buildings in Ettington dating from 1681,and is now a listed building. At present the rush wall covering is being renewed.This is an ancient form of insulation which though once common may now be unique.Also there are plans to extend the present single room accommodation by adding toilet facilities,a kitchen and children's room. Meetings are held on the first and third Sunday of every month at 11.00 a.m.
